    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(int x,
            int y)
        Creates an instance of Cell with given x-coordinate and y-coordinate with no piece placed in the cell i.e. piece placed in the cell is null.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cell.
        y - The y-coordinate of the cell.

    • Method Detail

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece()
        Returns:
        Returns the piece placed (null if no piece is placed) in this cell.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns:
        Returns the x-coordinate of this cell.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns:
        Returns the y-coordinate of this cell.

      • getCoords

        public int[] getCoords()
        Returns:
        Returns the coordinate of this cell as an integer array of length two, in which the first element is the x-coordinate of the cell and the second value is the y-coordinate of the cell.

      • placePiece

        public void placePiece(Piece givenPiece)
        Parameters:
        givenPiece - The piece to place in this cell. If the piece are to their opposite end then the piece is made King.

      • containsPiece

        public boolean containsPiece()
        Returns:
        Returns if the cell contains any piece i.e returns true if this cell contains piece and false if the placed piece of this cell is null.

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece(Cell anotherCell)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        anotherCell - Cell where the piece in this cell is to be moved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws IllegalArgumentException if the Cell provided is null.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the Cell.
